content:
Define a 16-bit register 'q' to hold the output values, which will be driven by the D flip-flops.

Retrieved Related Information:
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is low, all DFFs are reset.
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is high and byteena[1] is high, upper byte d[15:8] is written to corresponding upper byte of q.
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is high and byteena[0] is high, lower byte d[7:0] is written to corresponding lower byte of q.
source: The module should include 16 D flip-flops.

content:
Implement the logic for the synchronous reset. When resetn is low, set all bits of the 'q' register to 0.

Retrieved Related Information:
- resetn: Synchronous active-low reset signal (Type:Signal)
- q: 16-bit output data signal (Type:Signal)
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is low, all DFFs are reset (Type:StateTransition)
source: resetn is a synchronous, active-low reset.

content:
Ensure that the D flip-flops are triggered by the positive edge of the clock signal 'clk'.

Retrieved Related Information:
- clk: Input clock signal (Type:Signal)
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is low, all DFFs are reset (Type:StateTransition)
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is high and byteena[1] is high, upper byte d[15:8] is written to corresponding upper byte of q (Type:StateTransition)
- On positive edge of clk, if resetn is high and byteena[0] is high, lower byte d[7:0] is written to corresponding lower byte of q (Type:StateTransition)
source: All DFFs should be triggered by the positive edge of clk.
